Class Alignment

java.lang.Object
  Alignment
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlignNW, AlignSW
public abstract class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class is use to define correctly attributes and methods of alignments like NW and SW (distinct classes which extends this one). See the Direct subclasses for more details.

Author:
Gabriel Chandesris

 class Alignment.DiffTypSeqExc
          This exception appear when the two sequences are Nucleic and Proteic.

calculmatchmismatch

public int calculmatchmismatch(int j,
                               int i)
Deprecated. Method calculscore is a better way to do and give a result between two chars...

This method is used for comparison between two char in the two sequences

Parameters:
j - is reference to a char of the first sequence
i - is reference to a char of the second sequence
Returns:
1 for match and 0 for mismatch
See Also:
calculscore(int, int)

calculscore

public int calculscore(int i,
                       int j)
This method is a better version of calcumatchmismatch, and refer to some elements of LifeSequence to compute the score.

Parameters:
i - is reference to a char of the first sequence
j - is reference to a char of the second sequence
Returns:
Score in the substitution matrix table for those two char's
See Also:
LifeSequence.aminoacids, LifeSequence.nitrogenbases
